channel.title: Agentic Times - jBot's Curated Feed
channel.description: Curated insights on AI workflows, agentic systems, game design, creative tools, and modern development. Discovered and curated by jBot.

item.title: Preventing Data Exfiltration in AI Agents via Public URL Indexing
item.description: OpenAI has introduced a novel security mechanism to prevent AI agents from inadvertently leaking user data through malicious URL parameters. By cross-referencing requested URLs against an independent public web index, this system distinguishes between safe, pre-existing public links and potential ex

item.title: Quantifying Agent Reliability: 12 Metrics Beyond Success Rates
item.description: While AI agents are achieving higher scores on standard benchmarks, this improvement often masks operational fragility. item.title: The Measurability Gap: Why Verification is the New Scarcity
item.description: This landmark economic paper argues that as AI drives the cost of cognitive execution to zero, the primary bottleneck for growth shifts to **human verification bandwidth**—our capacity to validate, audit, and take responsibility for AI outputs. item.title: A Comprehensive Framework for Intelligent AI Delegation

item.title: DeepPlanning: Why Frontier Agents Fail at Long-Horizon Constraints
item.description: DeepPlanning is a new research benchmark designed to expose the limitations of current AI agents in handling long-horizon tasks with strict global constraints. item.title: How Strong Guardrails Turn Random Noise into Functional Games

item.title: Intelligent Delegation: A Safety Framework for the Agentic Web

item.title: Intelligent Delegation: Architecting Trust in the Agentic Web
item.description: As AI evolves from isolated chatbots to interconnected agentic economies, existing ad-hoc delegation methods are becoming dangerously brittle. item.title: Porting Ladybird's LibJS to Rust: 25k Lines in Two Weeks via AI
item.description: The Ladybird browser project has officially begun transitioning its core engine from C++ to Rust to ensure memory safety, starting with the LibJS JavaScript engine. Founder Andreas Kling successfully ported 25,000 lines of code in just two weeks by utilizing AI agents (Claude Code and Codex) as forc

item.title: Repurposing Old Kindles as Live E-Ink Dashboards via KUAL and Node.js
item.description: This technical walkthrough demonstrates how to convert an obsolete Kindle Touch (4th Gen) into a live, "set-and-forget" information display for transit times without sacrificing its original e-reader functionality. By offloading rendering to a lightweight Node.js server and using custom Linux script

item.title: Silencing CLI Output to Optimize Agentic Context Windows
item.description: AI coding agents often struggle with "context pollution" caused by verbose CLI tools, which waste tokens and confuse reasoning loops. item.title: The Blueprint for Safe, Scalable Intelligent AI Delegation

item.title: AgenTRIM: Balancing Tool-Driven Agency via Dynamic Orchestration
item.description: AgenTRIM is a security framework designed to mitigate risks in LLM-based agents by addressing "unbalanced tool-driven agency"—the tendency for agents to have either too many permissions (excessive agency) or too few (insufficient agency). Instead of relying solely on prompt filtering, AgenTRIM emplo

item.title: AgentSys: Preventing Prompt Injection via Hierarchical Memory Isolation
item.description: AgentSys introduces a defense framework against indirect prompt injection by borrowing "process isolation" concepts from operating systems. Instead of exposing a main agent to a cluttered and vulnerable context window, it spawns isolated worker agents to handle external tools and data. By allowing o

item.title: AgentThreatBench: Operationalizing OWASP 2026 Top 10 Agentic Risks
item.description: AgentThreatBench is a proposed evaluation suite for the `inspect_evals` framework that operationalizes the newly released OWASP Top 10 for Agentic Applications (2026). Unlike previous benchmarks that focus solely on prompt injection or harmful outputs, this suite targets agent-specific architectural

item.title: Exposing Agent Security Flaws with the AgentDyn Benchmark
item.description: Researchers from UIUC and other institutions introduce AgentDyn, a dynamic benchmark designed to stress-test AI agents against indirect prompt injection attacks. Unlike previous static benchmarks, AgentDyn evaluates agents in open-ended environments (like Shopping and GitHub) where they must disting

item.title: SaaS is Dead: How AI Agents Commoditize Software Interfaces
item.description: John Rush argues that the era of traditional SaaS is ending as AI agents and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) allow users to bypass user interfaces entirely. By enabling agents to interact directly with databases and APIs, the "UX moat" evaporates, shifting the market toward outcome-based pricing an

item.title: Why Agents Fail at 200k+ Token Workflows: The UltraHorizon Benchmark
item.description: While most AI benchmarks test short-term reasoning, UltraHorizon evaluates how autonomous agents perform in "ultra long-horizon" scenarios requiring sustained attention over 200,000+ tokens and 400+ tool calls. The study reveals that current Large Language Model (LLM) agents consistently crumble und

item.title: Building AI Immunity: The 8-Outcome Inoculation Framework
item.description: This paper argues that effective AI literacy cannot be taught through lectures alone but requires "inoculation"—deliberately exposing users to controlled AI failures like hallucinations and sycophancy to build cognitive resistance. Drawing on behavioral psychology and a pilot study with voice-based

item.title: Optimizing AI Co-Creation: Reflective Partners vs. Proactive Models
item.description: This randomized controlled trial investigates the critical trade-off in human-AI co-creation: output quality versus human agency. By comparing "model-led" interactions (where AI rewrites content) against "human-led" reflective workflows, the study reveals that while proactive AI produces technically

item.title: Optimizing TTRPG Hex Crawls with Multi-Scale Mapping
item.description: This guide contrasts two distinct approaches to wilderness exploration in tabletop RPGs: the traditional 6-mile hex crawl and a "zoom-in" 1-mile technique. It offers practical rules for visibility, point-of-interest density, and map management, specifically advocating for a clean-map indexing system

item.title: Sketching Software with Natural Language Nodes in tldraw Computer
item.description: tldraw computer transforms the popular infinite canvas into a visual programming environment where logic is defined by natural language prompts rather than code. This approach makes software execution transparent and accessible, allowing users to "sketch" non-deterministic, creative tools like write

item.title: The Contractual Codification of AI Agency: eBay's 2026 Policy Shift
item.description: eBay’s recent policy update marks a critical shift in platform governance: moving from generic bans on "automation" to explicit contractual prohibitions against "LLM-driven bots" and "buy-for-me agents." item.title: The Future is Bespoke: Ephemeral Apps and Agent-Native APIs
item.description: Andrej Karpathy demonstrates the power of "vibe coding" by building a complex, custom treadmill tracker in one hour using Claude. He argues that the traditional App Store model is obsolete, predicting a shift toward highly customized, ephemeral software generated on-demand by agents interacting with

item.title: Rendering Cistercian Numerals via 10,000 OpenType Font Ligatures
item.description: Bobbie Chen demonstrates how to abuse OpenType ligatures to instantly translate modern Arabic numerals into compact 13th-century Cistercian glyphs. By generating nearly 10,000 ligature definitions, this project explores the intersection of medieval mathematics and modern typography, highlighting bot

item.title: Solving the Mystery of Pikachu's Regional Color Shifts
item.description: Have you ever noticed that Pikachu appears "goldenrod" on American websites but a vibrant lemon yellow on Japanese ones? This deep dive investigates the technical root of this discrepancy, revealing how unprofiled CMYK assets and regional software defaults (like SWOP vs. Japan Color) inadvertently c

item.title: Mist: Frictionless Real-Time Collaborative Markdown Editing
item.description: Mist is a lightweight, web-based tool that brings Google Docs-style collaboration—real-time multiplayer editing, comments, and suggested changes—to raw Markdown files. Designed for an era where AI workflows and prompts rely heavily on `.md` files, it offers ephemeral sharing and preserves collaborat

item.title: Intergalactic Bastionland Launches Public Playtest for Space Bureaucracy RPG
item.description: Chris McDowall has officially opened the public playtest for *Intergalactic Bastionland*, the sci-fi evolution of his acclaimed *Into the Odd* system. item.title: Mastering Systems Design via Raph Koster's 12-Step Framework
item.description: Veteran game designer Raph Koster deconstructs the complexity of game creation into a twelve-step "cheat sheet" that moves from the definition of fun to the psychology of player motivation. The framework argues that successful games are not merely content or stories, but systems of uncertainty that

item.title: 10 Scalable Marketing & Sales Workflows Using Clawdbot AI Agents
item.description: This breakdown outlines ten autonomous marketing and sales workflows used to scale an agency using Clawdbot. item.title: Discovery
item.description: Marcelo demonstrates Muddy OS, a custom dashboard built on the open-source OpenClaw framework to manage a team of 25 autonomous AI agents operating 24/7.
